 My personal view. Despite our choices, we in Canada are entitled to fair treatment under national healthcare. That is, they should be entitled to go to the doctor and have the doctor look at them and tell them what is wrong and what needs to be done. That being said, I do understand the frustration on the part of physicians who feel that no matter what they say, patients ignore warnings. I imagine that after 35 years or so of having someone come in and complain about a dry, hacking cough while continuing to smoke a pack a day, I would suggest that the patient find a new physician.
 
 I believe that people who persist with chronic bad habits should not be entitled to transplants and be placed down the list on surgeries with wait times. Why give a lung to a smoker who has shown no desire to quit? Why give a heart to someone who refuses to take care of it?
 
 70% of transplant failures are due to non-compliance with the physiolocial and pharmacological regimes.
